predicate.note: Frames file for 'recognize' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes 29.5 30.2, other framed members include observe, deny; regard, scrutinize, study. Comparison with

roleset.name: assign a label or attribute

example.name: all args
example.text: I was pleased to note that your Oct. 23 Centennial Journal item recognized the money-fund concept as one of the significant events of the past century.
example.arg: one of the significant events of the past century

example.name: just transitive
example.text: The company said the move recognizes its strong financial position.

example.name: passive with it support
example.text: People were interested in seeing him, but it was recognized *trace* that the route was through Sotheby's and particularly George Wachter.''
example.arg: the route was through Sotheby's and particularly George Wachter

roleset.note: The trace and coref'ed 'it' don't play any thematic role and should be ignored.
Maybe this should be split into multiple senses. We'll see.

example.name: the public good
example.text: Decisions by the Second Circuit itself, Judge Oakes continued, had recognized that public interest in the subject matter and the indispensability in particular cases of verbatim quotations are vital components of fair use.
example.arg: Decisions by the Second Circuit itself
public interest in the subject matter and the indispensability in particular cases of verbatim quotations are vital components of fair use.
